A kit containing various types of armor plates, components and fittings for installation of armor-related upgrades. Armor upgrade kits are commonly used to improve or alter ballistic protection and other features of combat armor, protective suits, helmets, and other worn equipment. Kits include components and necessary tools to perform modifications on a workbench, usually found with faction mechanics or personal hideouts.

A kit containing high-quality weapon components and tools used to tweak internal weapon mechanisms. Mechanical upgrade kits are commonly used to alter or replace the inner parts of firearms to upgrade reliability in the field, improve ballistic performance, enable alternate fire modes, or even to convert a firearm's calibre. Kits include components and necessary tools to perform modifications on a workbench, usually found with faction mechanics or personal hideouts.

A kit containing tools used to modify and maintain the body of a weapon, including the barrel, rail, mount and weapon furniture. Body upgrade kits are commonly used to alter or replace core parts of firearms to improve ballistic performance, comfort and handling characteristics, allow for attachments like muzzle devices or optics, and to lighten the overall weight of the weapon. Kits include components and necessary tools to perform modifications on a workbench, usually found with faction mechanics or personal hideouts.
